Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Tracie G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December of 2011. I was travelling alone with my 2 young nephews. This hotel was perfect. It was in a great location, only 5-15 minutes from all of the sites we were there to see. I felt very secure at this hotel. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the staff were extremely professional and friendly. Our room was clean, well kept and beautifull. Even my nephews who were 9 and 11 at the time, commented on how much they enjoyed the hotel,especially the pool and the restaurant area. I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Marriott Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/23-3/25. Nice quick early check in with friendly staff. Excellent nights rest in a large clean room with two queen beds. Full clean bath with fluffy towels, Beds were very comfortable with lots of pillows.AC worked fantastic. Refrigerator and coffee maker a nice plus. Coffee shop and bar in lobby nice touch. Stopped in and got coffee creamers to bring to room for am coffee. Will stay here again and recommend when your in this area this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were expecting...”
Reviews.Author: NoStoppinUs
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 3 night stay. The beds were great! The young man who was always at the bistro in the morning was great as were all the staff members we interacted with. I only have 2 minor complaints. The elevators were incredibly slow and the bathroom grout seemed dirty...definitely not uniform in color and I wasn't about to touch it to see why. We got a great family deal that included bistro dollars and parking. All in all, a very reasonable price. We would stay here again if we were in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: LAGIRL75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location with our granddaughter and we loved it. The room smelled fresh and it was nicely decorated with a great view of the golf course and a lake across the freeway. The staff was very nice and helpful with every need. The location was very close to all major attractions and shopping centers were everywhere. Restaurants were within walking distance or a short drive away. Be prepared to pay for parking. I just don't get it, its not like they're sharing the property with other businesses or having to pay a persons salary for collecting payment because they charge you up front during check in. Overall we had a great experience and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gilbertgl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location 12-16 March 2012. If you are driving or will have a rental car, Hotel Circle is an ideal location right off I-8. The room was nicely decorated and extremely quiet. Since the room had a refrigerator, I called the front desk and asked if it was possible to get a microwave also, one was delivered within 5 minutes. The bathroom was large with lots of counter space. The room also had lots of lights and modern furniture. The Bistro was well stocked with a great menu selection and the food and service was always outstanding. The sit-down tables had individual televisions which was a nice touch. There were also taller tables with bar stool style seats. The Lounge area was modern and very comfortable. The business center was located in the same area. The front desk personnel were very professional and extremely helpful with any questions that I had. Housekeeping was also exceptional, when I got back everyday the room had been cleaned and looking like new. If you are going to visit San Diego and want to be located near the highway, I highly recommend Courtyard at Hotel Circle. I found everything that was talked about on Marriott's website to be true.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: ubergam220
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott Mission Valley is a fantastic hotel! I have to say, we took full advantage of most of the ammenities offered here and were greatly pleased. We checked in on a Thursday and had very friendly service from the front desk staff. Our room was clean, nicely decorated and the two queen sized beds were very comfortable for everyone in our party. We ate breakfast each day at the bistro and it was wonderful- very tasty and, again, great service. The front desk staff was very knowledgeable about area attractions and helpful with suggestions for restaurants and directions. They even provided us with a sheet of paper that listed directions, addresses and phone numbers for area points of interest. Housekeeping was great- the room was always clean when we came back from our daily adventures and any requests (extra towels) were filled promptly and with a smile. My daughter and aunt used the pool and loved it- the pool area is very nice, clean and relaxing. I utilized the on site laundry facility and found it to also be clean and reasonably priced. We found the location of Hotel Circle to be extremely easy access- you just hop on and hop off the highway to get anywhere- we found very easy and quick access to everything we were looking for- Sea World, the SD Zoo, Gas lamp District, Old Town, Mission Beach and Sea Port Village. Every place that we wanted to visit was quickly accessible and within a 10-15 minute drive from this centrally located hotel. The parking fee of $16 is clearly spelled out on the hotel's website, so I don't really understand why it is an issue for other patrons... we went to the hotel knowing full well what to expect. The parking lot was safe, clean and provided easy access to the rooms with keyed access. Thank you Courtyard Marriott Mission Valley for an exceptional stay, friendly service and your clean, well appointed hotel. Next time we're in San Diego, we will stay at the Courtyard Marriott on Hotel Circle.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location for attractions”
Reviews.Author: Heidi2442
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Hotwire so I got a pretty good rate. The rooms were decent size and had nice decor and was clean. It's located on a street called Hotel Circle and that is pretty much what it is. A line of hotels. One side faces the freeway and the other a big hill (and parking) behind it. So it's not for someone looking for ambiance or walking to shops/restaurants. It's a good central location (Zoo, Seaworld). I was looking to maybe stay in the Gaslamp or Old Town but noticed that most of the rooms only had 2 double beds. This has 2 queen beds- definately a plus for a family of 4. Only bad- parking is $16 night, which wasn't a surprise, but I still think that it's way too much for the location (plenty of parking). The pool area and gym were nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot31310
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriott on a recent business trip. Although it was centrally located, it wasnt easy to get to and at rush hour getting into the parking lot was difficult. There is a parking gate that you must get a ticket and daily parking is $16.00, which is a rip. The check in was OK, once in my room I found that the housekeeping wasnt that great. The carpet had a stain and in the bathroom there was a clump of black hair in the corner by the shower...gross. The bed at first seemed comfortable but had a lump in the middle. I had dinner at the "bistro" which is basically an overpriced snack bar. When I told the front desk of the housekeeping issues all I got was "I'm sorry". I am not sure if I will stay here again, the parking cost and lack of concern about the housekeeping issues were an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were just OK”
Reviews.Author: shandydog
Reviews.Content: I have gotten used to Courtyards providing nice free breakfasts so it was dissappointing that the food area charged and was also shut when we arrived at 9 pm. Pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: kvlansdale
Reviews.Content: We come to San Diego every February to attend a conference at a neighboring Hotel Circle hotel. We have stayed at several places, but had not found a hotel that we liked until now. The rooms were modern and clean, the beds were very comfortable. As my husband was on a special diet, we appreciated the ability to have a microwave delivered to our room. The Starbucks/Bistro in the lobby was very handy. There were only two things we disliked; the cross trainer in an otherwise stellar fitness center was pretty sucky (lucky for us, there was a 24 Hour Fitness a short distance away for our cardio) and the Hotel Circle parking cartel is obnoxious. I feel extorted every time I visit. Otherwise, it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good courtyard, unfortunately surrounded by too many low budget hotels and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Philippe_DC
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean hotel with good rooms, an above average reception (for a courtyard), centrally located for things to do in san diego, with a small pool, on a reasonable budget, this is it. If like me you are on a business trip and can afford to pay a little more to be in a location from which you can walk to nice bars and restaurants, find another hotel. The first day i turned around for 20 minutes without finding a decent place for lunch and came back to have lunch at the courtyard. Then i decided to either drive to the gaslamp district for dinner or eat in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and boasting good facilities”
Reviews.Author: avaotto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and close to most San Diego's attractions. Rooms have been recently renovated and very spacious. A good alternative when visiting SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend in San Diego - nicer than expected!”
Reviews.Author: bhatnasx
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if this hotel is brand new or if it's been majorly overhauled. The location is in Hotel Circle, so I'm guessing it took over some other property & was redone or they did a new build. The lobby is the new Courtyard lobby with the bistro (think Starbucks, but better in terms of food) concept versus the normal restaurant. Rooms were defintely stylish & nice - bathrooms were clean with marble countertops. Location is good, right off the highway - with decent dining nearby & easy on/off highway access. Parking was supposed to be $16/night according to the website, but we weren't actually charged - I think this was a mistake, but it worked out in our favor. Plenty of parking in the back of the hotel, the front definitely filled up. Front Desk staff & check-in girl were friendly. Didn't really interact with the staff that much except checkin/checkout, but it was a good experience both times. If going back, I'd stay there again - much newer product than most other Courtyards.

Reviews.Title: “the right choice for us”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler40
Reviews.Content: San Diego hotels are quite pricey. We were on vacation, not looking to break the bank, but still wanted clean and comfortable. This Courtyard by Marriott is grouped with others on Hotel Circle. Honestly, I wouldn't walk into some of the other hotels, much less stay the night. However, I felt very comfortable in the hotel and parking lot. The hotel seems relatively new. We stayed during the work week, and most of our fellow guest appeared to be there on business. The location is not anything to write home about, but attractions were only a short drive away. I would definitely stay here again.I like quiet and clean, and this hotel met the bill.Staff were friendly. Lobby bar was very busy in the evening. We spent time using the computer in the business center while doing did our laundry in the hotel machines.Only negatives were parking fee and no free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CinRoQ
Reviews.Content: We were "homeless" after giving birth to our first child since we were moving from San Diego to Seattle. We had to stay the weekend in San Diego and choose the Marriott. They were able to give us a room towards the very end of the hallway so our newborn's cries wouldn't disturb very many people Very accommodating and friendly staff. Centrally located in San Diego where all our friends could meet us. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel for visiting San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Cliff S
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very comfortable, clean and staff were welcoming and friendly. Love the hotel lobby with a coffee bar style atmosphere. The family really enjoyed the breakfast there. Pool was quite small but perfectly adequate. Easy drive into San Diego for major attractions and close to Sea World which was the primary purpose of our visit. Good value for money. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl25
Reviews.Content: Since I didn't have a car, we used transit. There is a bus stop across from the hotel that takes you downtown. As well, the Transit station for the light rail ( MTS)was about a 10 minute walk away. The rooms were well equiped, with a fridge,iron, coffee maker, hair dryer. It would have been nice if there was a in room safe, The beds were comfortable and there were a plenty of choices of pillows on the bed.Wifi connected well and the TV had a good selection of channels.Coffee in the lobby ,a great plus in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place amongst a mish-mosh of hotels”
Reviews.Author: honurider
Reviews.Content: The Good: The lobby has Starbucks and great little cafe where you can get snacks and sandwiches to eat there or to go. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My room, although the view was of rooftop heat/cooling unit, was a great room. A king bed, a couch, nice bathroom and desk for my laptop. Wireless was free, and the large screen TV, fridge and coffee maker was appreciated. The bed was very comfy and my room was extremely quiet too. I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza down the road and didn't find it to be as good a value as the Courtyard was. And I've stayed at Motel 6 in Hotel Circle too, and you get what you pay for there. I'd stay here again when in the area for business. The Bad: The $16 a day parking fee. That was outrageous! I have not come across these type of high parking fees at other hotels in Hotel Circle. In fact, Motel 6 has free parking, and the Crowne Plaza was $10 I think.

Reviews.Title: “A Shining Star in Sunny San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on Tripadvisor, and taking the advice of other members who were attending conferences at the Town & Country, I settled on this lovely property. It really should rank MUCH higher on Tripadvisor ... This really was the right decision. It was only about a 10-minute walk from the Courtyard to the Town & Country. Even late at night, it felt safe and of course this is a MUCH better hotel. Rooms were spacious, modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was good. While my room overlooked the freeway, I heard no noise. Both my partner and I slept very well (despite jet-lag). Staff were friendly and very, very helpful. As an Elite member, I was given 2 free drinks vouchers at check-in, which was a nice touch. We did try the breakfast one morning and while it was a little over-priced, it was more than adequate. If you want a good “real diner” experience, turn left out of the hotel and there is a great place a 5-minute walk away. Pool area was small but more than adequate and very pleasant. Nearby washer & dryer available for guest use was useful during our long trip. The gym was a good size. WiFI in the room worked well. There was free coffee in the morning or you could buy the Starbucks variety. The in-room fridge was handy. I had a fantastic stay and would defiantly give this hotel 4 ½ stars out of 5. Well done to Mark and all of his team! I would love to return ...

Reviews.Title: “You might get slammed with fees.”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a couple of weeks ago. I am a frequent traveler and stay in a ton of hotel rooms around the World, including numerous Marriott rooms. After I checked out of this hotel, I found that they had arbitrarily charged me for 268.00. After calling the hotel and speaking to the Manager Art C. on duty, I was told that I was charged for smoking in the room. Even after I explained that I don't smoke and have never smoked, he was adamant that I did and that he would not remove the charge. I am currently fighting this charge... I am compelled to write here to let others know that this is something that's begun to take hold with Marriott Hotels in particular. I've researched this issue (I invite you to do the same). I want to state that I hate walking into a room and having it smell like smoke. I won't stay in it and always ask to be moved to one that's not smoking. The profession I am in is not conducive for smoking and I am deeply saddened and concerned by the terrible treatment I've received so far by Marriott Management in this matter. I urge you to beware.... There are many hotels in this area. It's not called "Hotel Circle" for nothing. I would suggest something else. Marriott has gone downhill the past 3-4 years. They are definitely not the brand they used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, good location, close to nearly everything”
Reviews.Author: Getawayguy20
Reviews.Content: As a family, this hotel served us well. The rooms were spacious, clean and quiet. We took a room at the back side so that we weren't facing the freeway. Our girls loved the pool - it wasn't huge, but was large enough with a great space around it for lounging around as parents. Best part of the hotel is the lobby which served food at what we'd consider to be very reasonable prices and good quality choices. Also served Starbucks products, and had great spaces to relax, watch your own private tv, do work, or just hang out. Getting to other attractions (Old Town, Coronado, Mission Bay) was super easy and close. Good shopping nearby as well, within a 15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “OK but didn't really enjoy”
Reviews.Author: DavidBedfordshire_UK
Reviews.Content: To be fair the hotel did nothing wrong and our rating is probably based on the fact that we didn't like the new lobby area. The first impression on walking into the hotel wasn't good and that probably set our tone. However the room (away from the freeway noise) was very good and the staff were friendly and efficient. The bar/bistro area seemed to have a collection of different designs and it felt like eating in the middle of an airport terminal. We were given vouchers as part of our deal so we used them on one evening meal and a breakfast. The food was fine but we couldn't get over our negative feelings about the environment - sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ABUPALACESUCKS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days for a conference I was attending across the street. Rooms were great and very clean. Parking was $16 a night which I felt was expensive. My room rate was very fair. Bistro in lobby had excellent quality food, though at hotel prices. Will definitely stay here again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fall Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cwindsor8769
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. We typically stay in suites, so this is a change for us. However, the rooms are sized just right for a family of 4. Very close to everything, Sea World and Old Town are 5 minutes away, and downtown is 15 minutes from the hotel. The pool is a little cold, but the hot tub is awesome. The staff is very nice, including housekeeping. They do a great job. The Starbucks has good coffee, and we were able to get quick things like muffins or fruit for our kids for breakfast. Overall, we would definatey come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: junedog1980
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, and well-designed hotel. From check-in to check-out we had no problems. The rooms were super clean, and the housekeeping kept them spotless when we went out each day. The location was great and the fact they had free coffee and other amenities was a huge plus. For the price, you really can't beat this place! The only reason I didn't leave 5 stars is that they charge for parking. I know all the hotels around here do, but it still is ridiculous! My car is not sleeping here, I am. Please waive the fee in the future Marriot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Newer Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: KfromCal
Reviews.Content: Stayed over for a weekend while attending a Triathalon in Chula Vista. Noticed the location is near Sea World and Zoo also. Went to the mall close by and appreciated how close it was. An easy place to hang out if you need to kill some time. Very friendly, clean rooms and great amenities in the lobby. We did not eat at the restaurant but did get snacks to go from the counter which were great. A nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay! NOT The Parking Fee!”
Reviews.Author: GottaLuvMickey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over Labor Day Weekend for my daughter's 3rd birthday trip to Sea World. I got a little concerned when we checked in and saw soccer teams everywhere - 10-16 year olds - and I mean EVERYWHERE! We got up to our rooms, which were adjoining and on a high floor just like we requested, and were pleasantly surprised! The rooms are very spacious and clean and we couldn't hear any outside noise. There was a fridge in each room, neither of which got very cold, we asked at the front desk and they sent someone up to look at them - he said that they were working properly. I wouldn't suggest trying to use them for something that absolutely needs cooled, they really don't get very cold at all! The beds were great and really comfy! My husband was excited to find 7 different ESPN channels on the TV! The lobby got quite loud and busy in the morning and early evening when all of the soccer teams were coming and going, but other than that, we hardly noticed them there. We weren't exactly happy about being charged $16 a night to park in the parking lot, but what can you do?

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice overall.”
Reviews.Author: mike89t
Reviews.Content: Took my family to San Diego for the Labor Day weekend. There was 4 of us and it consisted of my wife, my 5 year old son, 7 year old daughter and myself. First of all this Courtyard is easy to find as it is right off I-8 with a bunch of other hotels in an area called Hotel Circle. Checkin was easy and the lobby looks beautiful. It's actually one of the nicer Courtyard lobbies I've seen. Parking is expensive and we ended up parking in the lot behind the hotel. Make sure your car has a solid parking brake because parking back here is basically on a hill with no curbs or anything to stop a car from rolling. I think we paid $16 a night to park at the hotel. So plan ahead for this extra cost. We knew about this cost ahead of time so it wasn't an issue. The rooms were clean and comfortable. However our room faced the Highway. It was extremely noisy and if you have a hard time sleeping with noise I would have a hard time recommending this hotel. Perhaps you could request a rear facing room if it is a problem? I can sleep through anything and so can the rest of my family so it didn't bother us too much. The pool area is also really nice looking for a Courtyard. They have furnished it with some classy outdoor furniture that is also very comfortable. However when we arrived at the pool there were no pool towels available. There was a stack of hand cloths from the gym stacked up but they must have been a joke. There is no way those would have been able to dry off a baby let alone a full sized adult with a hand towel. It think this Marriott really dropped the ball there. It appears that this location caters to youth sports teams on the weekends. There were a bunch of different youth soccer and football teams staying there. They even had a special breakfast set up for them every morning. So if you are a coach of a sports team you might want to look into that. For us it was more of a negative. There were a lot of young kids / teenagers running around unsupervised. It made a noisy hotel even more chaotic. Lets just say you don't want to stay here over a weekend if you are looking for a quite place to relax. We were at Sea World and Legoland all day so it didn't bother us too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great deal”
Reviews.Author: snickers3924
Reviews.Content: Great contemporary look and close to great outdoor mall outlets. Minutes awa from many local attractions. Only about two and a half hours away from Los Angeles :). Be sure to visit: Fashion Valley outdoor mall, Coronado Island, Coronado Beach, San Diego Zoo--Best Zoo ever!! For great fast food,visit El Pollo Loco andIn & Out Burger. For great seafood in a casual environment, go to King's Fish Restaurant. Buon Appetito (in Little Italy) is some of the best Italian Food you'll ever eat. Be sure to also visit Old Seaport Village. Have a superb lunch at the Edgewater Grill (as you overlook the harbor of the Pacific Ocean). You'll want t visit San Diego over and over again! What go to the Carribean when we have American treasures like San Diego (which has its own Coronado Island and other beautiful treasures)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Mike8o8
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, and very clean. I would definitely stay here again when I'm here in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service sucks, the stupidest I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: leonzhang
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights stays and actually stayed there for two nights with last night cancelled. When I checked out on the third day, the receipt looks alright with 2 nights parking fee. But after I saw my credit card bill days later, Courtyard charged me for 5 days parking! It's not the worst part. The accounting department, to which I was connected by front desk for this bill issue, never answered the phone calls for 3 days. I didn't even receive any call back for my voice messages in the following 2 days. I called them again, and eventually got the extension number from front desk to find an accounting guy . But this guy said they charged me for 5 nights and for TWO cars (!!) by some reason. I could believe that when he told me he could only take off two nights charge from my bill, without any apology. How ridiculous! I was totally pissed off and asked for his supervisor number. Ironically that number brought me back to the front desk!!! And the woman of front desk said she was able to help me fix it all over. WTF! Why didn't you guys do so at my first call?! The whole service system is just screwed up. BTW, the A/C is so noisy in the room, the fan of it suddenly started to run crazy with large noise for several times in the midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very convenient, staff Should know a little more about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JerseyNYC
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel late Tuesday evening or I should say Wednesday morning. I was checked in by a lady who works the overnight shift. As someone who works in hotels your first impression should come with a smile! She did not seem like she wanted to be there. I mean I know it's San Diego and you'd probably want to be out! But that was NOT how you welcome a guest. I had no eye contact with her what so ever. Whatever question I asked I felt stupid. I understand sometimes its the same questions. But Cmon this was my first time in California (my dream since I was 5 ) not impressed. Finally after checking in with my brother we walked into the room...a lot better than I expected. I got an amazing deal for this place and the rooms were absolutely beautiful! Very clean and new. My room is on the street side of the hotel. You can't hear any noise and the view is very pretty. Parking for the hotel is $16 a day. Not bad at all!! I understand some places offer free parking but this was a bargain! The third night I was there I stepped on a bee by there pool. I had the stinger stuck in my foot for about 15 minutes while I STRUGGLED to get it out. REASON: hotel does not offer a first aid kit. Only band aids. I was practically in tears from the pain, and I was told to go down the block to a liquor store and "maybe" they had something. Very disappointed. I finally got an alcohol wipe from the restaurant. Let me say "pricey or not" I would go to the hotels market EVERYDAY. They are so friendly and helpful! I asked them for recomendations in the area and they had plenty! They always had a smile on their face and are so happy to be there. By the way, it's hotel food so you can expect it to be pricey. But seriously it's not that bad. Complain when you go to New York! I would definitely come back. This is my first time in California and won't be my last. I loved it...thank you to the market staff for your reccomendations! I did a lot thanks to you!! Wish you worked the front desk =( I would also like to thank housekeeping for keeping my room so clean everyday! You rock! Love, Jersey!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, clean, nice location”
Reviews.Author: njm0058
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to leave this room; great bed, couch, computer setup, TV, bathroom was just ok. Convenient place to be in relation to getting to San Diego Airport. Nearby San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park. Best thing about this hotel was CLEAN, hip, quiet rooms but action downstairs if you need that. Bad thing was no free continental breakfast and food was pricey at Starbucks cafe. Walked a few blocks down the road and ate an awesome spot which had a wider menu than the hotel's cafe. not much around there except a mall across the expressway -- which is confusing north or south valley cirlce??? Went into nearby Old Town for dinner which is typical tourist trap spot, and another longer drive gets you to Gaslamp district for a more happening crowd.

Reviews.Title: “I'm torn about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Engineer911
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I needed a property that fell within a particular price range (business trip) but also had to be a Marriott (needs the points). It wasn't convenient for me with respect to where I was working, but for most people the location would be good. The lobby and rooms have been renovated so it's nice. Bed is good. Bathroom is nice. Tv is flatscreen but on some channels the reception is spotty. Parking is for a fee which I disagree with but we will let that factor slide. They have a cool lobby set up with the bistro and bar which has drinks and good food but they don't have room service. My real issue with the hotel is the air conditioning and the service. I am one of those people who needs their room cold- like arctic cold. And I also am one of those people who believe that if I'm paying for the room then I ought to be allowed to make it as hot or as cold as I like. Well, as soon as I got in, I cranked the digital wall control down to 60. I woke up at 2am thinking it was warm and looked at the wall control only to then notice the fine print sticker on it which says that the AC will not go lower than 68 and if you need help contact maintenance. Alright, so the next morning on the way out I called the front desk and asked for maintenance to come fix whatever limits they had set on the control so I would get cooler. I came back from work 12 hours later and no one had come up. The room was 68 although the thermostat was set to 60 all day. I called maintenance again. 20 minutes later the maintenance guy shows up. I ask him to please make it colder. He looks baffled and essentially fiddles with the wall unit and the actual AC by the window and then unplugs the AC then plugs it back it. He then proceeds to tell me he reset it so it will be better. I tell him the system is clearly set with a limit on how cold it allows you to make it and that there must be a button sequence or something to lower it. I know this is true but I also know it because otherwise there wouldn't be a notice on the wall saying call maintenance if you need it colder than 68. He doesn't know how to do that and insists he fixed it. I let him leave and sure enough 10 minutes later the air turns off again. Room temp is of course 68. What do I do? I proceed to take the condenser by the window apart and google the manual for it and then change the dipswitches on it so it now works as a standalone unit (sans wall controller). I turn the AC itself down to 60. And what do you know? It gets down to 60. I am writing this from my room right now which is wonderfully cold, no thanks to maintenance. All too many hotels these days are doing this- limiting your ability to control your own environment because they want to try and cut costs. Well eff em. I want it cold. And if you do too, almost every AC that is "limited" has a way to "unlimit" it. Most models are online if you google it. If you need help, message me. So yeah. Nice hotel, BS air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jubish3
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 7 night stay at the Courtyard Mariott Hotel Circle South and wanted to say it was a great time! The girls who worked at the front desk were so nice and always friendly when we would ask questions (which was quite often). Our room was lovely, and we really enjoyed the movies that were included on the TV channels! My boyfriend especially enjoyed having free HBO! I also was happy with the temperature and pressure of the water while showering. At most hotels I find the showers unpleasant. I loved the location of the hotel...it made our stay very enjoyable as we bussed everywhere and were happy to have 3 bus stops right in front of the hotel! (10 minutes to downtown, only 2.25$...much cheaper than taxis!!) We also enjoyed being so close to a nearby neighbourhood called Hillcrest which offers some of the best restaurants in San Diego! Also very close to Fashion Valley mall which is home to lots of the upscale brands, and also more affordable shops like H&M, Old Navy, Macy's etc...We made lots of use of the business centre in the lobby. We were almost always able to get a computer right away and it was very convenient for looking up bus times, booking excursions, researching restaurants, etc...they are a bit slow though, but the Wi-Fi I used from my phone was fast. Overall a great stay! I would come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: The good - I like this hotel. It's really clean, with big rooms, and there are views. Also, it's modern and looks newer than it probably is. The thing that really sucked about this hotel as well as others in the area, is the fact that you have to pay for parking. How ridiculous. Like it isn't enough that you are paying for the hotel room, they tack on another $15 - $20 a day for parking. Also, offer free breakfast...geeze! You can't get anything for free here, except for regular coffee. Seriously, what happened to the continental breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MemaM
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I stayed at this hotel for 1 week while participating in an escorted tour. I was extremely pleased with the accommodations and the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. Our room, which included 2 queen beds was large, and very clean. We made use of the fitness center and the outside heated pool. The hotel is located off a busy road, but I did not find that to interfere with the comfort factor. I definitely recommend this hotel I do not think that you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: OilmanTexas
Reviews.Content: Updated rooms, great functional lobby, and nice staff. We stayed at the Courtyard while in San Diego for our daughter's wedding. The room was nice, nothing fancy. The bed was comfortable, and flat screen tv worked well. The wireless internet was easy to access and the speed was ok. We really liked the new lobby design. Lot's of comfortable chairs. The food at the lobby restaurant was good and the prices were reasonable. There is free coffee in the lobby every morning. The staff was pleasant. Extra towels and hangars came quickly. Location was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business stay”
Reviews.Author: Smorris22
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of hotel circle this newer hotel has everything a business traveler needs: cleanliness, comfort and an adequate gym.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden fees, and no free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: SO2004
Reviews.Content: I had a training class in the area and it was extended an extra day. The hotel that I had been staying at prior to was full so I called the Courtyard Marriott to book a room I was told over the phone that the room would be $139.00 a night. I showed up later that day to check in my wife had dropped me off outside and I walked in while she was pulling in and parking our vehicle. The lady at the front desk gave me a slip for our vehicle for parking and told me to have my wife disregard the one that she was given when she pulled in our vehicle. We got our luggage out of the vehicle went to our room and relaxed. The next morning when we woke up I found a bill that had been placed under our room door on that bill we were charged $16.00 dollars for overnight parking which we had not been made aware of any fee over the phone when I called or when I checked into the hotel. On top of the hidden parking fee I was also charged an occupancy tax of $14.60, a California tourism fee of $0.05, and a TMD fee of $2.78 which brought my bill total to $172.43. I was not happy about the hidden parking fee and brought it up to the front desk when I checked out I was then told that they charge $16.00 dollars for overnight parking and if I had been staying at the Courtyard Marriott in downtown San Diego I would have had to pay $30.00 dollars for parking and to avoid the fee I would have had to park my vehicle off of their property. I then asked the lady where else could I have parked it in that area to avoid the fee and she was not able to give me any answer. As well as the fee incident we found out that we would have to pay for breakfast as well after we had gone done that morning to get our breakfast we were not made aware when we checked in that breakfast was not provided at all unless we paid for it. I will not stay at a Courtyard Marriott again their are many other hotels that are just as nice and offer free parking and free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: triphugger
Reviews.Content: Very modern and great helpful staff. Parking fee a bit too high, but if you get the breakfast bistro deal it is worth it. I recommend this if you are a golfing family. Great course across the street and great shopping right next to it. The beach a bit too far, if you want to go to the beach a lot go to La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Best Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: PattisGal
Reviews.Content: The Mariott Courtyard at Hotel Circle was not my best hotel stay, particularly in view of the fact that it was located in the heart of a center with hotels catering to conference attendees. Good Point: The room was nice, clean and attractively furnished. The room had a refrigerator and coffee maker, but no microwave oven. The bed was comfortable. Bad Points: This was a business trip booked by my employer. The front desk was not helpful in straightening out booking errors. Amenities: 1. There was no room service available. 2. The food service was poor. It did not have a real restaurant. You have to stand in line to place an order for either take out (a la McDonald's) or you were given a number and the food was brought to your table. 3. During the moring hours when guests were disbursing to meetings and trying to grab breakfast on the way, the line at the "restaurant" had as many as 30 or so guests attempting to place their orders. The choice of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner was very limited. There was a tiny little shop with no attendant (had to pay at front desk) when you wanted to purchase a limited array of food and other items. 4. There was no cocktail lounge. Mind you this is a hotel with several hundred guests. Not my worst, but not my best hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: momoffour5991
Reviews.Content: My children and I had a reservation at this hotel, but when we showed up we were told there wasn't anything under my name. It was 8:00 at night and we had no place to stay. We drove for hours and finally found a place 30 minutes away. Our vacation had to be cut short because the new hotel didn't have room. When I contacted the Courtyard Marriot after we got home, I spoke to numerous people, over three days (all charged to my phone) and was finally told that they would generously refund my money for the week's stay. Because someone had typed in my name wrong when they made the reservation, our vacation was ruined. I had stayed at this hotel before, but I won't again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: stevecmh
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a very good location. Nice lobby and smooth check-in process. The gorgeous pool area was the highlight of the property. Beautiful plants, very nice furniture including shaded hammocks. Also had a hot tub which I did not use. The concierge lounge was disappointingly small. No in-room safes either. It was a pain-in-the-neck that the only TV channel guide was accessed through the TV menu option. (Do they change the channels so often that they can't print a one page sheet for each room?) The bed left a lot to be desired. While the bed linens seemed to the latest from Marriott, the mattress was definitely not upgraded yet. On the plus side, the location was excellent...between Route 163 and US 805, just north of US 8. The property was only 200 yards from the Rio Vista light rail station on the Green Line. It was close to Chargers' stadium, and the Mission Valley and Fashion Valley malls. Great access to downtown, Balboa Park, Seaworld, as well as the attractions north of the city. Just $12 super shuttle one-way from the airport which is six miles away. I received a package during my stay and a $5 service UPS charge was surprisingly added to my bill. I thought this was very odd considering the package was delivered by UPS to the hotel shipping/receiving department. When I inquired about it with the front desk, I was told it would be removed. At checkout, it was still there but I did not have time to press the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rallen1023
Reviews.Content: I was lookiing for a hotel centrally located in San Diego. Went to priceline to see what I could get and was hoping for this property. Despite the attitude from the front desk clerk, we were able to get a 2 bed room without having to pay for an upgrade. (What is this from a hotel that participates in a program voluntarily??) anyway, once past the front desk, everything else was better than expected. The lobby is very inviting and offers a bar, dining area, lots of lounging or working space and a number of computer workstations for use. They have a nice gym and small pool area off the west side of the building. The rooms were very nice, well decorated and comfortable. Flat screen tv, refrigerator, free wifi, good size bathroom, etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated just below the Hillcrest area, just off the 8 freeway near the 163 connection to downtown and minutes from Sea World. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again on future trips to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but rowdy lobby atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: woolly1dog
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and two children for a trip that combined leisure and business. We arrived at 9pm to check-in and the lobby was full of guests socializing. This hotel seems popular for children's sports teams to stay and they were all up and having drinks and snacks at 9pm. The rooms were clean and modern. Curiously, the cabinet next to the TV was at an angle and looked like it was built that way. The room included a refrigerator and coffee maker but the coffee pitcher was missing. The floor we were on was relatively quiet unlike the lobby. The cafe in the lobby was convenient to buy breakfast with good hot and continental selections, and there was free coffee in the lobby each morning. I took a cab to the convention center (the ride cost $22) for a meeting. The location was not too far from Sea World (less than 10 minutes) which was the highlight of our trip. Although other customers complained about the $16 parking fee each day, I could see why they charged it because it would discourage nonguest use of the space the hotel guests needed. I worried we wouldn't get a space each night and sometimes got the very last space.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for San Diego Comic Con”
Reviews.Author: annaaltheide
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly comfortable hotel, great amenities like a mini-fridge, comfortable bed and pillows, very spacious, and an around-the-clock, very attentive staff. I'd definitely stay here again. If I had any complaints, it'd be that the parking was too expensive ($16 a day is highway robbery) and the bistro, although very tasty, was a bit on the expensive side, especially since there are no other budget restaurants or grocery stores on that side of Hotel Circle.

Reviews.Title: “They got the date wrong for our trip and manager would not refund our money!”
Reviews.Author: lauramillertexas
Reviews.Content: In May, my husband booked a room over the phone at the Courtyard by Marriott Mission Valley for July 2011. When he called the hotel a few weeks before our intended arrival, they had already charged us for $154.00 for one night in June! Apparently, the hotel staff had inputed "June 2011" instead of "July 2011" when we made the phone reservation. My husband explained that they had gotten the date wrong and we would not be traveling until July, but they would not refund any of our $154! He spoke to Marriott's corporate office, the accountant at the Mission Valley location, and the hotel Manager, Mr. Jim Blem. Mr. Blem refused to refund any money even though his hotel had made the mistake! He gave my husband the excuse that they were sold out for a conference that evening so it was his bad luck. After talking to Mr. Blem, we called back to Marriott's corporate customer service and they admitted their mistake but were only willing to refund us less than 1/2 of our money - $70. My husband travels for work all the time and will never stay in a Marriott property again. I can't believe they stay in business with such disappointing customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 4u2travel2anywhere
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Close to nearby attractions, less than 15 minutes away from Sea World and the Zoo. Our room was clean and comfy for 2 adults and 2 kids. Like the other reviews, the $16 parking fee per night is no fun, but we were well aware of it before our arrival, so no surprises there. The pool/hot tub is great and the lounge chairs are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night for business travel. Hotel looks old on outside but I found the rooms to be comfortable, clean, and updated. Quick drive to a mall with lots of shopping and dining choices. Great access to area freeways and quick drive to the airport. The lobby was updated and features a nice place to grab coffee in the morning and drink later in the day. Downside to the hotel is parking and parking fee $16/day-which is typical for hotels in the area. Parking doesn't feel very secure but no incidence to my car. I will stay at this property when I return to the area

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & clean room”
Reviews.Author: venkatjs
Reviews.Content: On a pleasure trip to San Diego, I stayed in this hotel, close to the freeway with many hotels around. The location is easily accessible. Though close to highway, it is noise free. The spacious hotel room that had two beds,was clean and provided free high speed internet. Even thought there weren't many choices for breakfast, it still met my needs as a tourist. Though parking fee is levied even for guest residents in most of the Hotels in US, I feel it is not fair as it is a basic necessity for a traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as most Courtyards”
Reviews.Author: JTAnewport
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Courtyards routinely on business travel, but found thi one to be below the general standard I am used to. This appears to be an older hotel that was purchased by the Marriott franchisee and converted into a Courtyard format, but only in the main lobby and rooms. I had requested an early check-in and admittedly got to the hotel even earlier than I had planned. The front desk said that the room that was reserved for me wasn't ready yet and there would be a 1-2 hour wait. Instead, I opted to take another room they offered that was ready. It was very small and dark, but since I was only there one night, I accepted it. First mistake. The air conditioning was via a standard through the wall unit, but was controlled by a wall thermostat that did not allow control of the mode (that changed automatically depending on what the set temperature was vs. room temp) and only one fan speed (high) which was noisy and woke me up several times during the night when it cycled on and off. The front desk gave me a VIP drink pass and gave me the impression the drink was complimentary. This was a miscommunication, as when I gave the pass to the bartender, he told me it was for a 50% reduction on the price, but was not free. This was a bit disconcerting, but I bought the drink anyway. To their credit, the spinach dip and chips I ordered was very good and a generous portion. Be aware that this hotel can be noisy. It appears to be oriented to groups, conventions and sports fans who attend games at the nearby stadium. They weren't rowdy, but were noisy in the halls and took over all the computers in the business center to play games, making it hard for those who wanted to use them for legitimate business. The computers are in an open area accessible to the public, rather than in a locked business center. Although they had a huge open parking lot in the rear of the hotel which was 1/4 full, they still charged $16.00/night for parking. While this may be acceptable in a congested city center, I have never been charged for parking in a suburban Courtyard. Another irritation! All these items are minor on their own, but added up to the least enjoyable stay I have had in a Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Longtime Marriott Member but Victimized by Establishment Manager”
Reviews.Author: Tbaire
Reviews.Content: In town for an Insurance Convention and decided not to stay at the facility accomodations since I prefer Marriott establishments. I was thrilled to find that there was a new Courtyard within minutes of the convention center. The rooms and service were adequate: the A/C didn't work @check in, the bathroom light burned out on my 2nd night, noticed black mold the ceiling hallways on the 4th floor and my vehicle was broken into in the parking lot. I contacted the manager John Belm and felt victimized all over again with the debating and judging of the items in the vehicle being fully exposed to the public for theft! Then he continued to inform me that the signage posted "Video Surveillance on Premises" does not mean that the property/parking lot has video. "Premises means building and that is what is under video". Mr. Belm continued to debate the establishments accountablility of liability without any concern for my ordeal. I was contacting the manager, Mr. Belm to request the corporations insurance information for my insurance company; I didn't need to be victimized again by someone who should be more concerned with the welfare of their customers than debating and argumentative over the liability of the establishment. That is why we have insurance company to sort out this sort of situations. If Mr. Belm had taken the time to look up my account information he would have seen that I am a long time customer of the Marriott Corporation and that for whatever the insurance company come to a compromise, the amount I spend in any given year with the Corporation would exceed by 10X or more. I know that that review may or may not persuade you to stay at this establishment, but the more you know about the "premises" or property/grounds security especially when they are charging a fee to utilize the establishments parking lot the more educational decision can be made. Also I am not impressed with the chosen person of their customer relations for this establishment. Maybe I caught him on a bad day; but I think my situation warranted some sort of compassion from a person in that position. Good Luck on your next stay and hopefully there won't be a crime committed at this establishment anymore severe than a theft of items from a vacant vehicle!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ptirvine
Reviews.Content: the is probably the nicest courtyard i have been to. the restaurant we pretty good with a good sized bar. we came with our son's water polo team so it would be unfair for me to complain that "kids were running around everywhere." yes they were mostly from our group. nice pool area, small, but nice. rooms were clean. buffet breakfast was a little thin on options, but you can order food from the restaurant/snack bar. Parking is extra, so tack it on to your price when you are comparing options.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms, horrible service and hidden parking fees!”
Reviews.Author: David201160750
Reviews.Content: 1/5 for the Courtyard, only because of the rooms :/ On phone and at front desk made it clear for a quiet room. Two hours later? Loud teenagers running in the hallway, slamming doors, and yelling next door. After 10pm the noise didn't stop, and when I asked the front desk I was told no more rooms were available, so I checked out and stayed with another person I knew locally. My presentation meant too much. I expected at the VERY least an apology, but all I got was an "OK, your all checked out" followed by "next customer please." They simply didn't care. Common courtesy and service should still mean SOMETHING in America! Oh yeah, by he way, no mention over the phone, but there is a hidden $16.00 (SIXTEEN) parking fee!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for hidden cost! $16.00 to park your car daily”
Reviews.Author: graciegirlcalifornia
Reviews.Content: Got a room thru Priceline and when I checked out I was told everything was all paid for until I recieved my bill thru credit card did I find out I was charged for parking when NO ONE mentioned such a fee! For that reason I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a relief -- no problems and no surprises”
Reviews.Author: ProfOrganizer
Reviews.Content: My friends joke that I have bad hotel room karma. In the past decade of attending a particular professional conference, something weird happens the vast majority of the time. Sometimes, it's dangerous and unacceptable; other times (like last year, getting a room shaped like an arrowhead), it's just weird. I'm so happy to say my experience at the Courtyard Marriott on San Diego's Hotel Circle was a complete delight and offered no surprises. Check-in went smoothly, taking no more than five minutes. Our room was clean (and my companion and I are both VERY picky about such things), the towels were plentiful, and housekeeping left the room tidy and organized before our return each day. The fridge housing could have been dusted a little better, but the bathroom and bedroom were spotless. The bed was firm, but so comfortable I had the five best night's sleep of the entire year, and the comforter was just the right weight. The air conditioning/heating control let us make the room the perfect temperature without excessive noise. This is the second time in six months I've stayed in a Courtyard, and I like the little touches like the mini-mantels with the black and white paintings, the excellent flat-screen TV with high-quality cable and spiffy, fashionable bathrooms, comfortable desk chair and numerous electronic input panels, easily accessible on the visible wall behind the desk. Two outlets at bedside, right under the bedside lights, enable charging of digital devices. This is a perfect room for the modern traveler. We loved that the free WiFi was blazingly fast; at our conference hotel (a five minute walk away), my colleagues were complaining that the paid-for Wi-Fi was unpredictable and slow, but because I'd read Trip Advisor, I knew to stay away from that venue for sleeping. If you're staying at an (ahem) conference center on Hotel Circle, stay here and walk the five minutes. The staff was friendly, and helpful, though a little unimaginative. The snack bar is right next to the bar; when the snack bar was closed at 11:05p and I wanted a juice, the young men behind the counter shrugged apologetically. I suggested they hand the juice bottle to the bartender and let her ring it up. After much discussion among themselves, they did that, but then the bartender gave me the wrong change without comment. When I pointed out the error, she noted that the bar only had quarters because of the bar's pricing methods. I had her give me back one of the quarters I gave her so that I could provide exact change. (It wasn't the money, but the principle of thinking someone wouldn't expect to get their change back.) All other experiences with the staff were exemplary. They called taxis for us which arrived (with the exception of our middle-of-the-night airport request) within five minutes. My requests for extra hangers and foam pillows were acted upon within minutes. The lobby was refreshingly modern and clean, good for hanging out and people watching, and though the computers and boarding pass kiosks were not enclosed, there wasn't much in the way of noise or distraction.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mpmnstr
Reviews.Content: Arrived at noon on a Friday and they had a room ready for us right away. What a beautiful room. We had 2 queen beds that were so very comfy. The side chair was also very nice quality and comfortable. Bathroom was a good size and the showerhead was great. Very polite staff at the counter, and no problem with anything during our stay. About 90 % of hotels I checked out in the San Diego area had a parking fee anywhere fron 12-32 dollars, so the charges are very typical of most in the area. The hotel was sold out the weekend we stayed, yet parking was easy to find, elevators arrived quickly, and we heard no noise from any other rooms. Overall an excellent choice, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just alright...”
Reviews.Author: JessJess249
Reviews.Content: I expected a lot more from this Marriott. My first problem was with check in. The girl was not a very warm person, maybe because she dislikes her job and she spoke to me way too fast. Next, I did not know that I needed to have at least the minimum amount of how much my total stay cost would be on my debit/credit card. I took everything out of my bank account so I could specifically use all cash. Due to that she informed me that my credit card is not valid. I told her that I only had $.40 in my account, but wanted to pay everything in cash. She spoke to me so fast that I can't even remember what she told me, but said it was fine and gave me my room keys. The next day I get a call from the front desk telling me my card is invalid and they need to have a valid credit card on file. This time I dealt with two unfriendly front desk girls that treated me like I should have known their credit card policy and how all hotels have the same policy. This was never informed to me when I booked the room at all, would have been a nice detail to know. The room was nice looking, but there were little things that showed that there was not enough attention to detail. Such as the nice looking chair had one arm rest cover missing and the arm rest had the zipper broken was half zipped down. The compartment that housed the refrigerator had some nasty white grease all over the bottom of the flooring. Personally the bed was uncomfortable because the mattress was posterpedic. Also the room only came with one packet of caffeinated coffee when it was obvious that there was gonna be at least two people staying in the room being that there were two queen beds. Hello! The extra mile goes a long way when it comes to customer satisfaction, maybe it's because the employee satisfaction here is lacking. On a positive note I did enjoy the bistro offering food, coffee and drinks. I would definitely not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by a false sense of security!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the San Diego area with my family. We chose this hotel because it was close to areas of interest to us like: San Diego Zoo, Sea World, USS Midday Museum, etc. The overall stay was ok. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Prices were reasonable; except the ridiculous $16 overnight parking fee. They claim they have "security" that roams the hotel grounds and have signs posted that say there's video surveillance. However, my gym bag and road side assistance kit were stolen from inside my SUV on the FIRST NIGHT we were there. I dismissed it as an accident at first thinking my wife had left my bag out by the car earlier that night when she went to retrieve some other things. Well turns out that the night before we checked out someone had gotten into my car once again! This time they took my daughters Gracco Play Pen and a second road side assistance kit I had in the SUV. How the hell does that happen not once, but TWICE!!! So don't think for a minute that your belongings are "SAFE" just because they claim to have security cameras, security guard walking the parking lot, or the "gated" access to the hotel. I was parked in both the front and back side of the hotel when my belongings disappeared.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and good service”
Reviews.Author: Bluejoecool
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 4 times since I've visited San Diego.. It's convenient because it's near 4 of the main freeways, not too far from all the activities, and mainly you don't deal with the hassle and bassle of tourist pedestrians... The staff are very attentive and the best of it all is the complimentary high-speed Internet. And if you dont own a laptop, they have computer with internet access available free of charge. The lobby is descent ffor a courtyard as well as the rooms. I would definitely recommend staying in this property. If only they had shuttle service to and from the airport, then again I always rent a car when Im there...

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: NHdaytripper
Reviews.Content: From time to time, I come into SAN to visit my son who is a college student. This is the second visit to this property. The first time the room I had was very noisy, a/c sounded more like a lear jet spooling up. This time I asked for a quiet room, not near an elevator. I got a room facing the highway;and just across the hall was the ice machine! I am an awards member, and I was using points for the stay, but come on. Then let's discuss the fee for parking. I don't see any value add with charging $16.00 to park. I was forced to park in the back; which is on a hill. Have you ever tried getting luggage out and having it stay in place without rolling downhill?? If the parking lot was secured, but it is not, unless you want to call the bar that goes up and down as you exit security. I like the Courtyard over at the airport much better, but it was booked, so I had to settle for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: yogaeon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice location, good staff and very good facilities. One small issue: No tea or kettle available in the room, only coffee machine. Airport pickup through EZ Ride shuttle at discounted rate for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Will stay there again when in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Futurist01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard from Nov 13 to 17, 2010 for a conference in a single king. The hotel and room were clean, the staff was especially friendly and helpful, and the bed was comfortable, I had no trouble falling asleep. There was free wi-fi, a nice feature. Even the water pressure in the shower was just right. The restaurant seemed a little pricey, but was comparable with other places I went, so maybe it's just San Diego. I didn't use the pool or exercise room, so I can't comment on them. My rate was $165/night as part of the conference. At that price I would definitely stay here again rather than take my chances elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely oasis in a strip full of highway hotels”
Reviews.Author: NanBug
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, most recently for 4 days. Love the place. It's extremely clean and quiet. The lobby and rooms are decorated in beautiful colors -- cozy oranges, sunny yellows and leafy greens -- it's very modern, hip and relaxing. The downstairs bar/cafe is perfect for breakfast, lunch, dinner or a late night nibble. They have happy hour every evening, which attracts a nice crowd. The food is good and not outrageously priced. My room was very quiet and had a sofa, plus a desk with a comfy Aero chair. Several pillows on the bed, plus a duvet and great mattress. Wifi worked well. I spent many evenings in the whirlpool outside, soaking the stress away. The hotel is a quick 15 minute ride to the airport, too, which makes it great if you don't have a car and just need a couple of cab rides to get you where you want to go. The University section is located behind the hotel and chock full of funky little bars, restaurants and a Whole Foods. Grab a quick cab or take a 20 minute (steep) walk up the hill. Neat neighborhood. All in all -- a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beds, best sleep ever!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieAus
Reviews.Content: As part of our dream holiday we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We had a wonderful time, staff was very helpful, especially Susan at the front desk who gave us great tips on where to shop and what parks to go first to avoid walking outdoors on a rainy day etc. Thanks so much for your kindness, Jackie

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, but the parking charge really irritated me.”
Reviews.Author: CasperUSA
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business, especially to the San Diego area. This hotel is conveniently located and was well maintained at the time of my visit. No complaints with the room, service, or amenities. But...BUT...they charge $16 for overnight parking and this really ticked me off. There are many hotels/motels of similar quality along this stretch of Hotel Circle that either provide free parking or charge no more than $10/night for parking. For some reason, this $16 charge really got to me because I felt it was excessive. Because of the latter I will look elsewhere for my lodging needs next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DrHickenlocher
Reviews.Content: As a business road warrior, I've been in my share of Marriott, Hilton, and other such properties. I decided to stay here based on three reasons: The Courtyard/Marriott brand, proximity to the Zoo and other travel destinations, and the fact that it offered rooms at 15K Marriott points per night where surrounding comparable properties nearby were 20K per night. I should have spent the extra 5K/nt. At first glance, Courtyard did a nice remodel on this place. The Lobby is really modern and nice. Granite countertops in the bathroom and great furnishings make the place feel like a full Marriott instead of just a Courtyard. But then you start to notice the details they didn't get right. First off, the bathroom light above the mirror had burnt out. To their credit, maintenance came and put in new bulbs in about 15 minutes. But why wasn't it fixed before? I'd rather have taken a shower than waited around wondering when somebody would arrive. Next, we noticed that the faucet is set back a little too far from the sink. Really, it's impossible to wash your hands without rubbing your hands against the back wall of the porcelain. And then there were the towel issues. There's no towel hook on the back of the door, so I had to hang mine over the shower rod. But where do I put my towel while my wife is showering? Plus, why were there only 2 towels in a room when we had 3 people on our reservation? And as for the towels themselves, they were more threadbare than a truck stop Motel 6. These are minor problems to be sure, but I didn't have to deal with them at other hotels, especially other Marriott properties (including Fairfields!). The room itself was quite comfortable. King-sized Marriott Bed, sofa, desk, LCD TV. Again though with the details. The closet doors are hung so poorly that it's impossible to close them properly. And there's a neat bank of four electrical outlets built above the desk... that don't work. Left my phone charged in for a couple of hours before realizing that it wasn't charging. At least there were no bed bugs. But probably the biggest problem was with the paper-thin walls. We have a toddler and specifically requested a room far from the elevators to minimize hallway noise. Didn't help. I've stayed at a zillion different hotels and this was possibly the thinnest-walled hotel I've ever been at. You try sleeping when rowdy football fans come back to their room at 1am, and things are so loud that you can hear every f-bomb and sarcastic comment in clear English right behind your head. Seriously, I've never been able to eavesdrop on a full conversation the way I was in this hotel. Last, the parking lot. $16/parking is highway robbery, but I won't dwell on that. More annoying is that you have to ascend 15 steps to get from the parking lot up to the lobby. We were able to drive our car up to the front doors for loading and unloading, but it's a hassle. Beware for the handicapped or those who have difficulty with stairs. The hotel is very pretty on the outside. The furnishings are very nice. And it IS clean. But unfortunately, the attention to detail isn't worthy of the Marriott Brand. Next time, I'm staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “looking forward to visit CA”
Reviews.Author: dave7313
Reviews.Content: bed bug site says 'zero' reports of bed bugs here... hope that's true.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Zearisia
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked fantastic online. When we arrived (before check-in time due to lack of traffic) everything looked really clean and chic and new. Well, we arrived at 11am. The woman at the desk wouldn't really make eye contact, but told us we could check in at 1pm. Okay, so we go out for awhile, and come back at 1pm, only to be told by a different employee (who also is incapable of making eye contact) that we won't be able to check in until 2pm. Okay. We sit in the lounge for awhile. Got a snack ($20 for a sandwich, water, muffin, and soda, ridiculous.) and waited until 2. At 2, we are told by yet another employee that we can't check in until 3pm. More sitting in the lounge. Plugs on the floor/tables did not work so I couldn't plug in my laptop. Finally get checked in at 3:30. Elevators are SLOW, SLOW, SLOW. And dirty. We arrive at our room and everything looks fairly clean and new. Very nice looking. Shower could have used a good scrub, though. And the toilet seat was a cheap, uncomfortable plastic one. We get changed and leave for the day. We come back at night and there are children running and screaming EVERYWHERE. We wanted to go work out in the fitness center but there are children playing all over the exercise equipment. Okay, so we go to the pool. More children EVERYWHERE, splashing and screaming. My god. We spend a little time in the pool, and then head back up to our room. We get changed for bed and go to sleep. Throughout the night all we could hear was 1. the extremely loud air conditioning going on and off, 2. our neighbors doing absolutely EVERYTHING. We could hear even their conversations and televisions, and 3. door slamming. So much door slamming. And loud pounding from children running through the halls. After a rough night of sleep we are awakened at 6am by more screaming children, door slamming, loud conversations, and pounding. How thin are these walls, seriously?! We will not be back. Free wifi is nice, but who doesn't have that these days? Parking costs $16 a night. We spent $330 to stay for 2 nights, and then we have to pay for 2 days of parking as well? Ridiculous. All the neighboring hotels offer free breakfast. This place doesn't give you ANYTHING. Free coffee in the rooms. Big deal. We came expecting a marriott. Did not happen. We might have had better luck at the holiday inn express, which at least gives you breakfast for your trouble.

Reviews.Title: “One word... dirty”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasOki
Reviews.Content: Ok, I really want to be fair. I am writing this from the hotel room. This is a Courtyard that really needs to clean its act. Everything is just plain... dirty. The room is full of hairs... the sink, the bed... Everywhere!!! Elevators have not been vaccumed in a lifetime. But well, things like this happen... But such unprofessionalism from Marriott? Waiting for morning to move somewhere else. For the money, this is a rip-off...

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel appearance wise!”
Reviews.Author: LuvPapillons
Reviews.Content: Well we went to San Diego for a football game. The check- in process was fine and the room was nice. There was plenty of parking although it costs $16.00 per night which sucks when you are already paying to stay there. They had real hot coffee in the lobby in the morning which was good. A lot going on at this hotel weddings the football game and just tourists. So anyway my peeve is "Commom Hotel Courtesy" the people in the room next to us were so rude! They put the latch between the door and the wall and were going in and out of the room back and forth to another room letting it slam! at all hours of the night talking on their cell phones in the hall right in front of our door, and then starting at 6 a.m. with the slamming of the door again! UGH!!!! I complained 3 times and finally they moved us from the 6th floor to the 2nd floor. It just sucks that the they didn't make them move. So i would just stay at a different hotel next time is what i put on their comment card.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: JeremyChloesMom
Reviews.Content: We drove to San Diego on our family vacation heading out at the wee hour of 530 am, we arrived at noon and was allowed to check in early, the lobby is gorgeous and the staff were very friendly. It defiantly has a contemporary feel and I wasn't so sure it would be suitable for young kids but it worked. We got our room and unloaded or things, my youngest did find a dress that some one had left behind inside the dresser drawers tucked behind the drawer(leave it to a 6 year old to investigate everything!) The rooms are very pretty. Major down fall for my husband and I bed by window was super soft. up every other hour because we sunk in to it. Next night we moved kids to other bed and it was a little harder but not much. Only other issue we had was only 3 large towels for 4 people. But nothing major. All in all the hotel was very convenient for sea world, san diego zoo, old town, and seaport village. I would stay here again in a heart beat. Friendly staff over comes any little problems, hotel was clean, friendly and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “clean”
Reviews.Author: linzlu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. It was clean, check in was easy, the beds were pretty hard and the $16 for parking was a bit much, I really wish hotels would just add that into the room cost. We had a second floor room overlooking the pool. Beware of a pool view room, the pool is open from 8am to 11pm, people will be in the pool all day and night past 11pm and are very loud, lots of yelling. We kept on the fan in the room to drown out the pool noise. Otherwise we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: HI_Nokaoi
Reviews.Content: We were taking my Aunt and Cousin to San Diego for the first time so the location was great. The hotel is a solid three with it's recent upgrades. Check in smooth, rooms nice and pool area was nice. We went through priceline so we didn't really chose the hotel, but after staying I would recommend it. We were facing the West, it wasn't that noisy as others have commented on. Negatives would be $16 a day for parking, really? hotels in Hawaii with no where else to park aren't that expensive, towel in the pool area could be nicer and maybe someone monitoring the workout room, kids were messing around in there could get hurt. Nice place, great location 5 min to Sea World and to the Zoo

Reviews.Title: “nice but overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: elatho
Reviews.Content: The rooms were well appointed and pleasing to the eye. It appeared that a renovation had been completed recently on everything but the beds. My husband coined the beds as "taco beds" because as soon as you got in the mattress gave in around you. We both woke up with backaches. We had a room that faced the back parking lot so although we did not have noise from the highway, we could hear our neighbors talking. We were awaken each morning by people in the other rooms near us. On the first night of our arrival after returning to the room for the evening, I wanted to get online to check my email and search out some restaurants and sites to visit the next day. I was not able to connect to the WiFi network. The front desk was unable to assist me so they referred me to an 800 number. After about 30 minutes of trouble shooting, I was told I would get a call from a senior troubleshooter. By this time it was 1:15 am. I never did get a call back, however the next night I was able to get online without a problem. When we arrived in the room, there was no remote control for the TV. I called the front desk and they brought me one promptly. Again, it was late so by this time we just went to bed. The next morning when I tried to turn on the TV to get the weather and news, the remote didn't work. No time to fuss with that. Later we requested another one. The 3rd remote appeared to work fine. One thing that really turned us off was the condition of the elevator floor. It was filthy and cluttered with visible dirt that could easily be removed with a vacuum cleaner. We stayed 3 nights and it appeared that no vacuuming occurred the entire length of our stay. Another inconvenience is that ice is only available on the 4th and 6th floors, so if you happen to be on a different floor, you're in for a walk. All these minor inconveniences add up to a less than positive experience. If the room was less expensive, it would have been easier to swallow, but for the price we paid it was unacceptable. In the past we have stayed at the Crown Plaza down the street. The rooms are much roomier, and the bathrooms fit two people comfortably at the same time. Their rooms are also less expensive. Next time, we will probably go back to the Crown Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Broomy57
