Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, like all of the hotels in Hotel Circle, but it's loud. Our room faced I-8, and we had constant traffic noise. We asked, but there were no room available in the back. The walls seemed thin, and we could hear the family next door talking very clearly. It also had individual AC, rather than central, so when it was on it blew a lot of air and was very loud, and it went on and off throughout the night. Not a very restful night, and I wear a hearing aid. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Free Wi-Fi was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice, just didn't have the best experience”
Reviews.Author: MicahsWifey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were newly weds staying at this hotel upon suggested from my job. We are from Texas but my job has offices in San Diego too. Well, overall, the hotel was pretty nice. The food in the bistro/restaurant was just "okay" and overpriced in my opinion. The second night we were there, we decided to go down to the hot tub before dinner. There was already a young lady in there and she started a convo with us, then her aunt later joined. After a few minutes, I started smelling a very strong ammonia like smell and so did the other guests, soon after that, it seemed like the water continued to get hotter to where it was no longer comfortable and my skin started to itch! Needless to say, hubby and I got out and headed upstairs to shower and change for dinner. While on the elevator, another guests commented that the chlorine must be strong tonight. I go upstairs, take off my swimsuit and saw that the hot tub water faded my brand new suit I had only just purchased the day before when we arrived in San Diego. I informed the front desk thaty maybe someone needed to check the water and they said they would do so. Upon checkout, after having washed my suit twice and the smell was still there (and of course the color was ruined), I asked if it were possible to refund my money for the suit since I had just purchased it ( I presented the receipt and everything). The front desk clerk took the suit and receipt to the back to a manager, I guess and they refused to refund because the suit's label said "do not bleach". Well, I told her I didn't bleach it, I went swimming in THEIR hot tub which is what swimsuits are made for. She couldn't help me though and it really put a damper on our trip! Well, I finally contacted corporate when we got back to Texas and dealt with a very nice man from the executive offices who refunded the price of my suit and offered us 2 nights free stay! That certainly made up for it. I just wish the manager on duty had been as nice. That really was my only complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Rolla01
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean. Our room was facing the parking lot at the back and we can't hear any traffic noise. Parking fee is expensive, and lot is always full. Staffs were friendly and helpful. Only 10-15 minutes drive to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but beware of freeway noise”
Reviews.Author: talimoth
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one evening with my sister before I met up with my husband for a business trip. When I checked-in the lady at the front desk said there was a handicap room available. This meant it would have no bathtub but a larger walk-in shower. I asked if it was a quiet room away from the freeway and she said that the room windows are triple sound-proofed so noise would not be a problem unless I lived out in a rural area in the country somewhere. I laughed, took my key and headed up to my room. I walked in and proceeded toward the bed and I heard car after car zooming down the freeway. This was unacceptable for a good night's sleep so I went back to the lobby and informed her that even though I was there for only one night I needed a quieter room. The next room I was given was fine. It had 2 queen beds and was clean and spacious. There is a shopping center right across the freeway and many restaurants to choose from. This hotel is close to all the major San Diego tourist destinations. I would stay here again but I would make certain it was not directly facing the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Need to enforce "no smoking" policy”
Reviews.Author: juanereeno
Reviews.Content: We tend to stay at Marriott hotels because they're clean and typically smell fresh (meaning smoke-free as a couple of us are allergic to cigarette smoke). Our room was beautiful, with a lovely view, and everything was brand spanking new. It really was a treat and our kids loved it. One night when we were watching a movie after a long day at Sea World our room suddenly smelled of cigarette smoke. We sniffed around our room and looked in the hallway outside our room and couldn't determine where the smell was coming from. A couple hours later our room smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke again. Once again we tried following our noses to figure out from whence the odor was emanating and couldn't find a thing. The next morning as we were preparing for the day our room reeked of the smoke. We went out into the hallway and saw someone exiting the stairwell which was just a few feet away and the scent of smoke followed him as he walked past. The next time we smelled the smoke in our room we quickly looked at the door to the stairs and saw the culprit smoking in the stairwell. At this point we called the front desk to complain that someone was smoking in the stairwell in this supposedly "smoke-free" establishment and each time he lit up the smoke was coming in through the vents in our room. We asked if something could be done to dissuade said smoker from infecting our lungs and we were told that while they do have a no smoking policy, it was not something they could/would enforce and, basically, it was too bad for us. We complained a couple more times when our friend lit up, but were always told the same thing--they just didn't have power to enforce their own rules. Seriously people. So while the hotel itself was beautiful and new and clean, it really was pathetic that the reason we stay at Marriott hotels (their non-smoking policy) was a complete farce and apparently something they couldn't actually enforce.

Reviews.Title: “i just want some sleep!”
Reviews.Author: lensmonkey
Reviews.Content: So here I sit, on my bed. It's 2:15 in the morning. And the people next door have been at it for HOURS! Sure, in my travels I've had amorous neighbors before. Being Marriott Platinum, I've spent lots of nights in hotels and I understand what goes on between adults when there is a bed around. But people, Come on! Just how many guys are there in that room? This is taking kinky to a whole new level! And is it too much to ask to turn down the deep house music? The base really travels through the walls. Not that I haven't asked. I called the front desk three hours ago. And I called your room half an hour ago. And yet, I still hear that gawd-awful sound from room 728. Is it not bad enough that my room has to wrap around the elevator shaft, that I have to hear you and your hyper-base boom box for hours? SHUT UP! GO TO SLEEP! It's not a bad hotel, really. Nice lobby, nice staff. Maybe too nice, as even after my call to the desk the orgy next door is still raging after six hours. And in a few hours I'm gonna get screwed, too, when I have to cough up my hard-earned cash for a room that I got no sleep and a big headache in. So you, Trip Advisor reader, may not have to deal with the swingers next door. But if you platinum status gets you a suite, and the number has a "30" in it, (730 in my case) realize that you'll be at least listening to the elevator go up and down. And if this review seems to ramble just a bit, hey! Cut me some slack! it's 2:20 a.m.! And I still hear the music. I'd call room 728 again, but don't think it would do any good.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, new twist inside this Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: cologal23
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated,this Courtyard includes a full service dining experience area on the main level, plus fun add ins like a Wii, bar, and TVs (much appreciated during March Madness!!!). My colleagues and I met here every morning for breakfast - but even better also offers food to go. Location is ideal for anyone going to Sea World, plus great shopping blocks away including Nordstroms, Saks, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Safe bet”
Reviews.Author: FrankGradal
Reviews.Content: In an area of mostly motel like hotels, or an exensive conference hotel with low end reviews, I chose Courtyard. That turned out to be a vise choice. The hotel in- and outcheck were effective, and the same for the breakfast and lunsj area. Free internet and a very big plus for a free business center with easy access to prints. The rooms have carpet on the floors which is not a personal favorite. That said the rooms were clean, suitably large and overall quiet. I did miss a safe for valueable items though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: soutwesttraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon, and we absolutely loved it! It was beautifully decorated, and had convenient internet access in the lobby, the location was close to everything. The rooms were very clean and quiet and we enjoyed our view of mission valley. I definitly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: richvegas
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a weekend of 2 nights. Had a king room with sofa bed. Spacious and clean. Great service, we had our 3 yr old son with us and they made us feel welcome! Overall, the place is beautiful and would highly reccomend staying here. Just a little dissapointed with the Bistro, the food was so so, would have been great with breakfast included with the price. But, if food isn't your thing you'll love it

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for your Hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: travelinLeese
Reviews.Content: Originally was to have stayed at the Town and Country Resort across the street - it was horrific and we checked out after the first night. (My friend was attending a business meeting there and they had booked her room there.) Being a Marriott member, I saw the Courtyard across the street and we booked the rest of the week there for a less rate and an incredible room and stay. The room was a great double queen size suite with a great view. We loved the bar and bistro, lobby area and ate and drank there frequently. The service at every turn was outstanding and the rooms were clean and spacious. The pool area was great and welcoming. Thanks Courtyard for saving my tag along week of vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, with horrible service”
Reviews.Author: well_traveled69
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of this hotel for a little 5 day vacation. As business travelors we stay only at Marriott properties, so we know what to expect. This was way below our expectations. The hotel itself was very nice. The rooms were comfortable, the internet was fast, but there was not 1 employee we encountered that I would give any sort of kudos to. I tried calling in a few days before to check on my reservation and Joe was soooo rude. It seems I got him everytime I called, so by the time I got there I was expecting Joe to check me in. However, this other rude young lady checked us in...ugh...we then came down to ask Rachel for a taxi, after her refusing to make eye contact for the first 2 minutes, she finally asked us," what we needed" and called us a taxi. The gentalman at the bistro, which cost us $40 for 2 people to eat there ( 1 egg, toast and potatoes for both of us), was just as rude. They have this crazy abrasive wall paper in the hallways, my daughter and I were simply walking down the hallway and my arm brushed up against the wall and gave me the nastiest wall paper burn ever. When I called the front desk, they did not apologize or anything. I still almost 1 week later have a big sore on my arm from this. Due to the staff at this hotel, I will NEVER stay here again. They all need serious attitude changes. I was soo disappointed in this property. You can tell this was a franchise, a corporate Marriott would never let there staff treat high paying guests like this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, welcoming and perfect location, if one is driving”
Reviews.Author: RNDChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I did go through the reviews on trip advisor before finalizing on this hotel and it was truly a rewarding experience. Agreed there a few annoyances like extra charge for pretty much everything ($14/day parking, extra charge for a micro oven in the room, extra charge for a late checkout (after 1PM) etc.), but the staff is amazingly courteous and friendly. the hotel has been redone and looks very modern and trendy. You have to have a car to go any place from this location, but almost all points of interest in San Diego ( Zoo, Old Town, Coronado etc.) are no more than 10-20 mins. from this hotel. We never ate at the hotel but they do have buffet breakfast and other a la carte choices. If you can live with $14/day parking, this hotel will not disappoint and I would gives hats off to the hotel staff for that.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard was an asset to my vacation”
Reviews.Author: AFLORIDATRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: The hotel proved better than I anticipated. Spent 8 days there with a family member to see the sights of San Diego. The front desk staff were very professional, especially Daniel who remained courteous and informative despite our many questions. The room was immaculate, and maintained that way everyday. The a/c may have been a little noisy, but I considered that a minor concern and just turned the TV up a little. Other than that, the room was quiet, could not hear any voices from adjoining rooms. The individual Cuisinart coffee/tea maker in the room provided a good first cup until we got our Starbucks downstairs at the Bistro (another real plus). The lobby appeared well-organized with adequate seating areas for dining, working and lounging. Location was great, easy access to the expressway and public transportation. The trolley station across the street proved to be efficient, clean, inexpensive and convenient for access to the downtown areas, especially off peak hours. Enjoyed visiting San Diego and the Courtyard added to that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: californiaicurn
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, the #1 most important thing for me is the bed and this one was almost as good as my own! I only wanted to sleep while I was here. This hotel was clean, staff was mostly friendly (encountered a single snobby lady, but with how many people work here, how can you expect everyone to be perfect?). We were early and our room was not ready, but they permitted us to leave our luggage in a locked room, which was really good. The hotel is a bit off from everything, so if this is important to you, be forewarned, you will need to have a vehicle to get to anything. Great price, overall extremely happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it..with a caveat”
Reviews.Author: KOinCT
Reviews.Content: I agree with other posters who say the location leaves much to be desired. It's best if you have a car as it's not really walking distance to anything (but a GREAT mall is within 5 mins by car!) Granted, I had to be in the area for work, so a lot of the complaints don't really apply. But I can imagine if you're a tourist and hoping to see the town by foot, it might be a drag. However, with that being said, I still loved, loved, loved this hotel! The lobby is open and airy and the rooms are immaculate. I loved the fact that you could just grab a quick breakfast at the counter instead of having to do a big, elaborate meal like most hotels. Check-in and check-out was a completely smooth process and the staff were so friendly. I agree with others that the Wi-Fi is quick and appreciated the fact that it was free in the rooms. I also LOVED the do-it-yourself airline boarding pass printing area. They had a little printer in the Lobby dedicated for this purpose (free of charge). It was a nice little perk to be able to print it the night before. The rooms were so comfortable and the bed was a dream. Perhaps my only suggestion would be slippers in the room (or maybe I have been traveling throughout Asia for a little too long?!!) As opposed to other posters, I didn't hear any street noise from where my room was located. And for being a mid-size hotel, they also had a perfectly decent gym with good equipment. All in all, an excellent, excellent stay. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and kudos to the Courtyard Mission Valley for really helping me to re-assess my opinion of the Courtyard Marriott chain in general! If all the re-modeled Courtyards are like this, I'm a devoted convert! (I want to shoot myself for not taking pictures, but the ones already posted seem to be a pretty accurate representation).

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but average overall”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice - once with a car and once without. This is a recently renovated hotel with large rooms, that are very clean. The rooms were certainly the best feature of the hotel. Each room was equiped with a refrigerator and single cup coffeemaker. The price was very good too ($104/night). The hotel served a decent breakfast buffet, but the cost was high. Free internet was fast. There was no restaurant to speak of, only a bar and bistro that served wraps and burgers behind a glass counter. The location is relatively poor. Located right off an major interstate - there is considerable road noise. There are no restaurants within a short walking distance except the expensive restaurants at the Town and Country Resort across the highway. Most restaurants 1 mile away - far for walking at night, but OK if you have a car. The hotel charges a large parking fee ($14/day) making the cost of keeping a car high. I think next time I will stay near downtown - which is a better location for walking around. However, the price of this location is a detinite plus for the quality of room. So if price/value for nice room is your criteria and you don't care about location - this is your place. But if location is important - there are better choices downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Enthusiastic staff and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Gamegirl13
Reviews.Content: We had a number of people travelling with us, ranging in age from elderly to young teenagers and everyone in our party had a great time! The staff was very accomodating and friendly. The pool area was very inviting and relaxing. The bistro served great food and was very convenient for meals on the go. The location of the hotel makes it close to everything; however, it is the friendly, enthusiastic staff that makes this hotel a great place to stay in San Deigo!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNerdboy
Reviews.Content: The renovations were fabulous. The lobby is open, clean, and inviting. The rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable. Check-in was fast and the auto-check-out is even faster. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb! Close & convenient to attractions,dining,shopping”
Reviews.Author: ZmeisterJane
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience in this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This is a non-smoking hotel located near everything. At first I had wanted to stay near the downtown area thinking there would be more going on but couldn't be happier with the location of this hotel. The hotel had a recent renovation and was very upscale. The Bistro had good food and while a tad pricey, the portions were large. Convenient computer area, wireless service, boarding pass printers and an area with tv and Wii gaming for the kids.The pool was just the right temperature and had towels available and there is a 24 hour fitness center. Our room was very modern we had a king bed and the mattress was excellent, it was so comfortable! We didn't use the maid service daily but she was always in the halls and gladly gave us anything we needed. Flat screen tv, refridgerator, coffee maker (Starbucks served downstairs) and plenty of outlets to plug in cell phones, laptops, etc. Only complaint would be the amount of closet/drawer space but we managed to make it work. Most places do not offer free parking and downtown there were places I researched that were up to $35 per night, this was $14 per night. You are able to jump on all the major road within a minute of leaving the hotel making it very easy to get to Sea World, Zoo, Balboa Park, Downtown, Beaches, Harbor. Also just the other side of the highway are many nice dining places and shopping at the Fashion Valley Mall. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend staying here for your trip as well. Got a great deal on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Balance of Luxury and Affordability”
Reviews.Author: Bruingal79
Reviews.Content: PROS: I went to San Diego for a short leisure trip from Los Angeles and wanted a place that was close to the Zoo, nice but affordable. The Marriott was a lovely choice. It is updated and modern and has fun, elegant touches everywhere you look. The bistro located off the lobby has pretty good food and a good happy hour. They have private televisions at a lot of the tables and a Wii set up for the families and children. They also serve Starbucks coffee. The 24 hour market in the lobby is also a nice touch. The fitness center is a dream. Loved it and want to go back just so I can work out in it. Pool was small but nice. On site guest laundry, business center and plenty of meeting rooms. The particular room I had was a wee bit small but the price was right so it was no biggie. Theres a coffee bar, a fridge, updated bathroom, flatscreen, a business desk with plenty of outlets for all your electronic items and a SUPER soft bed. CONS: As so many people have mentioned, one MAJOR issue is the 14.00 parking. I am from Los Angeles, the land of expensive parking, so I wasnt so shocked about this but for 14.00 I expect (AT LEAST) a secured, covered lot. This lot is not secured, (although they claim it is) and there are NO places to park your car in the shade during the vast majority of the day. So, most of the time you come out to a car that has been in direct sun and is 110 degrees inside. Why am I paying 14.00 a day for that??? [To management-- I get it, you need to make some money off of parking but, for what you are providing, 14.00/day is ENTIRELY too much money and it leaves people with a bad taste in their mouths and takes away from the fact that this is a fab hotel.]

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Ridiculous Parking Fee”
Reviews.Author: mimiKc
Reviews.Content: I would be very upset if I paid full price for this room. I got them for $79 a night through priceline. Room is nicely decorated with modern contemporary decor. The 2 queen beds was more than enough room for 2 adults and one 10yr old. Overall I was pleaseed with our stay and would stay here again for the right price. Pros: Beds are soft and the swimming pool was nice Free Wifi Food-They have a place called the Bistro in the hotel that's open until 10pm, a bit pricey and they don't deliver to your room. The food tasted OK. HD flat panel Cons: $14 a day parking. We were told we needed our hotel key to gain entrance after 11pm as the lot is secured, we never once saw a guard or had to use our card to gain entry when coming in late. I think this fee should be eliminated if it is not truly a secured lot, especially for those paying $200 or more per night. Bathroom Sink-Drains really slow but it woudnt stop me from staying here. Bed bugs or Spiders-We slept in one bed instead of using both as the first 2 days 2 out of 3 of us had little bites on us. I think I was bitten by a spider as it swelled and stayed swollen our entire trip (7days) **This one makes me hesitant about staying again** Staff-Overall they were nice, but they seemed a little irritated when we called to tell them our house keeper failed to give us new bath towels. They promised to send someone up with towels and never did, we had to grab some from a housekeeper's cart that went by. She acted as if I was disturbing her when she picked up. Maybe because we booked through priceline. I don't think staff should treat priceline customers any different, it's the hotel's decision to utilize that option anyway.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but feeled ripped off on parking”
Reviews.Author: fmlsj
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay overall but probably would not stay here again since there was a hidden $14 dollar parking charge, We stayed for a week and the parking really adds up. i would definitely reconsider staying here again if they would do away with this lousy and undisclosed parking fee. I really wish the management would look into this issue and come with a solution. It's not appopriate to force the fee on their coustomers since most people would have drove to the hotel. I had never paid a parking fee staying with marriot and was just dissappointed for this.

Reviews.Title: “Unfornate details detract from potential good stay”
Reviews.Author: reeltell
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice location. For the money however, I am disappointed due to: broken sink upon arrival to room, "complimentary coffee"= 1 single cup (I booked the room for four), the room was almost $200 and they charge you $14 per day to park in the parking lot (are you kidding me???), check-out time is 12:00, but your access keys will stop working at 9:00 AM (I had two cards, both stopped working at 9:00 and we got locked out of the hotel from the pool), finally- the bill that was given me says $249.05, but the hotel apparently chose to round it off to $250 which is what the bank transaction states. It really is too bad and I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill by Financial Tourist”
Reviews.Author: FinTour
Reviews.Content: I was told during check in that I was going to receive complimentary parking then I was charged parking even though the checkout lady said no extra charges. I stayed 2 nights but their pathetic records show 3 nights so they charged me one extra night of parking. It will be a hassle to go through their accounting dept. to get money back. So in a nutshell, those people are clueless or a bunch of liars.

Reviews.Title: “I saw a bit of something everyone's said, now, regarding proximity....”
Reviews.Author: BillFromSoCal
Reviews.Content: Looks like mine is the first "Family Trip" review so rather than repeating comments, I'd suggest reading all reviews for suggestions like what floor and facing side works best for you. We did, reserved ahead, and had a hassle-free stay in a freeway-facing room on the 8th floor. Our trip was with friends & kids for two nights, visiting Sea World (twice), the Zoo, and a school trip to Balboa Park. For those of you considering both Sea World and the Zoo in one trip, the hotel is right in the middle of those attractions; with GPS driving time to either is only 10 minutes. Complaints about air conditioner noise - our's (at least) was in the room, not central air. Fans make some noise but we didn't hear any from neighboring rooms. Yeah, no, it is not a brand new, first class hotel but you aren't paying for that either. The elevators work fine now, everything was clean, the pool & spa was a pleasant surprise, and the staff was friendly and efficient (i.e. can we have more pillows). You can use one of those wheelie carts for luggage without having to tip a Bellman, so that makes up for parking and counts for Marriott points. If the hotel is gulty of anything, it is probably for trying to be something for everyone - the Bistro, open area business center, bar and sitting areas all being together on one side of the lobby. For a trip like we took (Sea World/Zoo/Balboa Park/kids/friends) we would choose this hotel again and I'd suggest you could do a lot worse on Hotel Circle.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated - Too bad it was All Form, No Substance”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy001
Reviews.Content: Snazzy, stylish, and contemporary, I was immediately impressed as I walked in my room. The flat screen HDTV, the media connection console, the cool bathroom sink, the newness of it all was very seductive. But the love affair did not last. First, I noticed the sink drained very slowly. Well, can't let a little thing like that get in the way of love. I took a shower, and noticed the screws attaching the holder to the tile wall were starting to rust already. Some were missing caps. I used the toilet, and noticed the seat was the cheap thin plastic kind. I started to wonder... is the honeymoon already over? How long will the renovation last? As the night wore on, I realized this love affair cannot go on. I started to hear my neighbors talking. Yes, I could hear their conversations. Not a good sign. At around 10PM, my adjacent neighbors in room 915 were in the mood for, shall I say, romance. Without getting into details, let me just say that I could hear EVERYTHING! Later, my other neighbors in room 919.... well, you get the point. In the end, this was a one night stand for me. I need much more than a pretty face for a lasting relationship. Sorry Courtyard, I don't think we'll see each other again. Oh yeah... one more thing... this place charges $14/night for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Can't wait to stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: jreelfs
Reviews.Content: Overall I must say I love this hotel, I have stayed at this location in the past when it used to be a Holiday Inn and it was alright, pretty outdated decor, However with the Courtyard buying the property it is like day and night. I love how they completely updated the decor inside and out, everything is very modern and contemporary looking now, Plus the addition of the Bistro in the lobby is excellent. The thing I love most about this hotel is the rooms, everything is very spaced out from the moment you walk in the door. The beds are very comfortable, the linens and carperting are always clean, along with the bathroom being completely spotless. I love the fact that there is a mini fridge in the room. Plus i love the fact that they added a flat panel television into every room, with some free HD channels as a bonus. The desk is great and I think the panel built into the wall to connect your computer to the television is an amazing idea, I want one in my own house. Also the cabinent they chose for the housing of the television/ desk/ lighting is really unique and I think looks great. The bathroom is spacious enough, although my only complaint is while the air conditioning is controlled through a remote unit, it is still an old fashioned air conditioner and not built in, meaning it is suprisingly loud and when on automatic setting turns on and off at randoms times waking me in the middle of the night. However becasue the room is so nice I can put up with it. The little restaurant they have downstairs called "Bistro" is great, I wen't down there one morning expecting to find extremely overpriced food and was pleasantly suprised to see somewhat reasonable prices on good portion of food. I had their breakfast sandwich with a side of fruit and it was delicious, especially the fresh fruit. The lobby itself looks great and I like that their is a main entrance in the front, plus an additional entrance in the rear allowing people who parked in the rear of the building easy access in and out. The only thing I wasn't too fond of was that they charged a parking fee of $14 a night. I understand that at the Doubletree because it's underground parking and patrolled, however here at the Courtyard it's outside parking and I doubt they hire someone to patrol it. There is a security gate however but I doubt thats doing much work, every time I drive in and out no matter what time at night the gate is always open. The staff was pretty good overall, I have stayed here a couple of times and the first time I was waiting in line at check in and as soon as one of the clerks freed up I started to walk up to check in, however I was cut in front of by an employee so she may purchase a snacked good, I figured i would just tell the manager, however as the associate left the clerk was standing at the computer so I walked up to check in and without saying a word she just turned around and went in some office. 5 or so minutes later she came out and before I could ask to see her manager because of the way I was ignored I glanced at her nametag and it said manager. That is unacceptable behavior by any employee to ignore guests, and it's worse when it's the manager doing it. Managers need to be re-evaluated for customer service skills. On the other hand the other few times I have stayed at this hotel the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. It is becasue of the room quality and the overall staff friendless that I will return to this hotel, if I had to be checked in by that manager each time I would definitely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Starbucks in lobby a big++++”
Reviews.Author: chuck50
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great staff especially at the Bistro and having Starbucks so handy was a great plus for a business traveler BUT honestly $14.00 a day for parking!!! My boss nearly flipped out over that one. The room and bed were very comfortable but the disturbingly loud air conditioning woke me up several times during the nite. I have to be in San Diego approximately every 4-6 weeks for 2-3 days at a time but I'm not sure if I would stay here again due to lack sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Clean, Incredibly Nice Staff, and Affordable Bistro”
Reviews.Author: Trip4AWeekend
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for a girl's trip with my mom. We loved the location as it's very convenient to everything. Even though it's right off the highway (literally) it's very quiet in the room. Every staff person we encountered was incredibly pleasant and the general mgr even took the time to help us get directions to some activities. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean (and I'm picky). The fitness center was nice with updated equipment. The lobby bistro has a limited menu but I ate there about 4 times and was able to have something different every time. I would definitely stay here again on a return trip, whenever that may be.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Area!!”
Reviews.Author: malern61
Reviews.Content: I just got here today and was impressed with property upon arrival. Very clean, modern, and up to date. Although front desk was very busy and hostess was alone, she was pleasant and had a great personality. Room is spacious, clean, and very nicely decorated. After spending the afternoon walking around area I realize I found a jewel. Most hotels in this area are older and look like it......the Courtyard stands out for its decor, cleanliness, and rooms. Though I'd prefer to stay downtown (my company scheduled its meeting out here but I did not want to stay at the host hotel....after seeing it, I'm glad I didn't.). Nice restaurants and high end shopping within walking distance. If you're going to stay in this area, there is no other option. I'm in room 735 and there's a nice view of a hillside and USCD medical center. Dr. E

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, easy to downtown”
Reviews.Author: conflictsgirl
Reviews.Content: I was going to San Diego for business. My last trip, they put me downtown but this time, for some reason, rates there were higher. I found this hotel from searching and reviews and decided it was a go, esp. once I saw it was a recent re-do. Pros: Free wireless, loved the desk setup in the room. Easy to get to downtown and airport (nice drive through the park via the 163). Lots of dining/shopping options in the area. Convenient if overpriced cafe and sundry shop in the lobby, but they made a tasty breakfast. Con: Stiff mattress and the parking fee. I'd expect that downtown, not in Mission Valley. One of the two elevators was down during my stay, and as an earlier review stated, they were pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnSF8
Reviews.Content: Hotel seemed brand new. Lobby is great with a small bar, restaurant, coffee house. Lobby is very comfortable with big touch screen information monitor, groups of couches, small tables with personal TV's, etc. Room was very nice with new furniture, nice lighting, spacious, internet, flat screen TV, etc. Cons: No fan in bathroom (not a good thing for my roomate after I beached one). Also bad acoustics. You can hear everything in the hallway and what the people in the next room are talking about and watching on TV. $14 parking is pretty steep considering the location. The Vagabond hotel next door had free waffles for breakfast--squat from Courtyard.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Mission Valley/Hotel Circle
HotelInfo.Address: 595 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
